newsitem.title: UK: Ford says no one hurt in UK plant chemical spil.
newsitem.headline: Ford says no one hurt in UK plant chemical spil.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said on Friday that an unspecified amount of hydrochloric acid was spilled at its Halewood car plant in Merseyside, northwest England.
No injuries were reported, and production at the plant was unaffected, the company said.
The spill of the diluted acid occurred at about 0450 GMT on Friday and was caused by flange failure on a storage tank, the company said in a statement.
Merseyside fire services and Environment Agency officials were called in to handle the spill.
"We don't have any further information in terms of size of the leakage," spokesman Simon Sproule said.
"Production is unaffected, and the employees are not at any risk," he added.
Hydrochloric acid is used in the paint shop at the plant, which produces Ford Escorts and is one of the company's three vehicle production sites in Britain. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
